column2: Fundamental HTML elements used to structure and define the content of a web page
opening tag
closing tag
used at the beginning of html documents to set file type
creates an HTML document
sets off the title & other info that isn't displayed (meta tags are placed here)
sets off the visible portion of the document
puts name of the document in the title bar; when bookmarking pages, this is what is bookmarked
Adds meaning to content for better structure and accessibility
header of a section or document
navigation menue
the main content of the document
generic section of the document
self-cotained piece of content
content that is related to the content around it
the footer of a section or a page
Elements that provide metadata about a web page - placed in <head>
sets a single-line text box for picking a color
controls how content is displayed on different devices
specified the author of the page
Formatting in HTML involves using tags to apply various styles and emphasis to text
creates a new paragraph
inserts a line break (carriage return)
puts content in a quote - indents text from both sides
used to format block content with CSS
used to format inline content with CSS
groups multiple HTML elements together, allowing them to be styled collectively
provides a unique identifier for a specific HTML element
Text tags include elements used for structuring and displaying text content on a webpage
creates preformatted text
creates headlines -- H1=largest, H6=smallest
creates typewriter-style text
used to define source code, usually monospace
creates a citation, usually processed in italics
creates address section, usually processed in italics
emphasizes a word (usually processed in italics)
emphasizes a word (usually processed in bold)
underlined text
strikethrough text
Creates bold text (should use <strong> instead)
Creates italicized text (should use <em> instead)
Sets size of font - 1 to 7 (should use CSS instead)
Sets font color (should use CSS instead)
Defines the font used (should use CSS instead)
Links are created with the <a> (anchor) tag, allowing users to navigate to other pages or resources
creates a hyperlink to an external page
creates a hyperlink within the page
creates a hyperlink to an email address
creates a target location within a document
creates a link to that target location
provides an accessible label for an element when a visible label is not present or sufficient

column1: Visit URL in a new tab
column2: Specifies where to open the linked document (Blank used for new tab/window)

column1: Link with a title
column2: provides a title for the link, often displayed as a  tooltip
Lists in HTML are used to organize and structure content
creates an unordered list (ex. bullet point)
creates an unordered list with circle hallow circle points (default is standard bullet points)
creates an ordered list
creates an ordered list with uppercase letters
creates an ordered list with roman numerals
creates an ordered list starting at a specified value
encompasses each list item
creates a definition list
precedes eachdefintion term
precedes eachdefintion
Graphical elements in HTML are used to incorporate visual content into web pages
sets background to specific colour
inserts a horizontal rule
sets size (height) of horizontal rule
sets width of rule (as a % or absolute pixel length)
creates a horizontal rule without a shadow
adds image; it is a separate file located at the URL
aligns image left/right/center/bottom/top/middle (CSS)
sets border of image, in pixels
sets height of image, in pixels
sets width of image, in pixels
sets alternative text for accessibility and displays if the image cannot be loaded

column1: Tables (use only for data layout - use CSS for page layout)
column2: Tables are created using the <table>, <tr>, <td>, and <th> tags to organize data into rows and columns
creates a table
sets off each row in a table
sets off each cell in a row
sets off the table header (a normal cell with bold, centered text)

column1: Table Attributes (only use for email newsletters)
column2: Table attributes used to customize the appearance and spacing of HTML tables
sets the width of the border around table cells
sets amount of space between table cells
sets amount of space between a cell's border and its contents
sets width of the table in pixels or as a percentage
sets alignment for cells within the row (left/center/right)
sets alignment for cells (left/center/right)
sets vertical alignment for cells within the row (top/middle/bottom)
sets vertical alignment for cell (top/middle/bottom)
sets number of rows a cell should span (default=1)
sets number of columns a cell should span
prevents lines within a cell from being broken to fit
Forms in HTML are used to collect and submit user input
defines a form
creates a scrolling menu - size sets the number of menu items visible before user needs to scroll
creates a pulldown menu
sets off each menu item
provides a label for items in forms to improve accessability
creates a text box area. Columns set the width; rows set the height
creates a checkbox
creates a checkbox which is pre-checked
creates a radio button
creates a radio button which is pre-checked
creates a one-line text area. Size sets length, in characters
creates a submit button. Value sets the text in the submit button
creates a submit button using an image
creates a reset button
creates a password
creeates a file input field in a form
creates a hidden input field within a form (invisible on front-end)
contains a group of related form elements
provides a title or caption for the group of forms
Tag attributes provide additional information about HTML elements
sets a single-line textbox for email addresses
sets a single-line textbox for URLs
sets a single-line textbox for a number
sets a single-line text box for a range of numbers
sets a single-line text box with a calendar showing the date/month/week/time
sets a single-line text box for searching
sets a single-line text box for picking a color
represents reserved characters without HTML confusing it with other code
Represents the less-than sign (<) in HTML.
Represents the greater-than sign (>) in HTML.
epresents the ampersand (&) in HTML.
Represents a double quotation mark (") in HTML.
